entries.text: YES! To get the ball rolling, Dancer2 now has its own namespace, and has been released on CPAN. Dancer1 also saw its first release of 2013, and has new  maintenance stewards.
entries.title: Dancer and Dancer2 both available on CPAN

entries.text: Like Catalyst? Like REST? John Napiorkowski presents new features of the latest Catalyst, including the option to limit actions to specific HTTP methods.
entries.title: Catalyst Built-in Support for HTTP Method Dispatching and What's Next?

entries.text: As an echo to the TWiki release of last week, Foswiki 1.1.8 is now out.
entries.title: Foswiki 1.1.8 released

entries.text: YAPC::NA comes with a neat list of satellite classes and courses. Be sure to have a peek and see if anything's for you in the lot.
entries.title: Get the most out of YAPC by signing up for Training

entries.text: Test::NoWarnings: useful, but flawed. David Golden: pragmatic, but impatient.  Say hello to his latest module, Test::FailWarnings.
entries.title: Alternative to Test::NoWarnings

entries.text: Timmy had Lassie. What's-her-name had Flipper, and What's-his-face had Skippy. Yanick, it seems, has a pet caribou.
entries.title: Showing Off Template::Caribou

entries.text: domm walks us through a bug-hunt through Module::ExtractUse's codebase.
entries.title: Module::ExtractUse 0.29

entries.text: Quick, what's the difference between [:digit:] and [:xdigit:]? If you are not sure, the pretty graph generated by  Peteris Krumins might be able to help you.
entries.title: Visualization of Regular Expression Character Classes

entries.text: A new Pod to HTML converter is born (Toby Inkster being the happy dad).
entries.title: Pod to HTML

entries.text: Dominic Humphries discovers named captures, and he likes it.
entries.title: Named regex captures

entries.text: Perl. Constants. Eduardo AriÃ±o de la Rubia goes "shake-shake-shake" with that Pandora box.
entries.title: use constant will surprise you with its evil

entries.text: Sqitch ALL THE PLATFORMS!
entries.title: Sqitch on Windows (and Linux, Solaris, and OS X)

entries.text: Sometimes, miyagawa reminds us, local crud (like the MYMETA* files) gets bundled  in CPAN distributions, something that could easily be prevented by a few judicious lines in the distribution's MANIFEST.SKIP.
entries.title: stop shipping MYMETA to CPAN

entries.text: Eduardo AriÃ±o de la Rubia continues his quest to find which constant module to use. He's been told that Const::Fast is faster, so he benchmarked it.
entries.title: More on constants in perl

entries.text: Rejoice, game makers, for Kartik Thakore lets us know that the SDL2 API is stabilizing, and that the work on its Perl bindings is under way.
entries.title: SDL2 C library API is stabilized

entries.text: Gabor offers us a primer on Perl's very own markup mini-language.
entries.title: POD - Plain Old Documentation

entries.text: The title pretty much says it all. Thanks for John Napiorkowski, the list of features for the next Catalyst release is on Play Perl, all ready for your voting and commenting pleasure.
entries.title: Catalyst Backlog for Next Release on Play Perl

entries.text: A video introduction of cpanm 1.6 by miyagawa. Brace yourself for an onslaught of awesomeness.
entries.title: Introducing cpanm 1.6

entries.text: Warm up the popcorn, and prepare to enjoy Schwern's 90 minute presentation on Git.
entries.title: Git for Ages 4 And Up

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.

entries.text: March 13-15, 2013, Berlin, Germany
entries.title: German Perl Workshop 2013

entries.text: March 22, 2013, Bern, Switzerland
entries.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2013

entries.text: April 19, 2013, Arnhem, The Netherlands
entries.title: Dutch Perl Workshop 2013

entries.text: April 20, 2013, Baltimore, DC, USA
entries.title: DC Baltimore Perl Workshop
